required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Supervised Clinic-to-Community Exercise Intervention to Improve Cardiometabolic Health in Survivors of AYA Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Supervised Clinic-to-Community Exercise Intervention to Improve Cardiometabolic Health in Survivors of Adolescent and Young Adult Cancer: The ACSEND Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The main goal of this clinical trial is to use a novel exercise intervention to improve cardiometabolic and biopsychosocial health outcomes in overweight/obese sedentary survivors of AYA cancers at risk for chronic comorbid conditions. The investigator's hypothesis is that an exercise intervention will improve: cardiometabolic health; body composition; physical fitness and biopsychosocial outcomes when compared to the attention control group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: insulin resistance estimated by HOMA from a fasting blood sample

primary_outcome.measure: Cardiometabolic health - metabolic syndrome waist circumference
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: markers of metabolic syndrome, waist circumference via measuring tape (cm)

primary_outcome.measure: Cardiometabolic health - metabolic syndrome blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: markers of metabolic syndrome, blood pressure via Omron cuff (mmHg)

primary_outcome.measure: Cardiometabolic health - metabolic syndrome blood measures
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: markers of metabolic syndrome, triglyceride, via blood draw

primary_outcome.measure: Cardiometabolic health - metabolic syndrome blood measures
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: markers of metabolic syndrome, cholesterol via blood draw

primary_outcome.measure: Cardiometabolic health - metabolic syndrome blood measures
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: markers of metabolic syndrome, glucose via blood draw

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: fat mass and lean mass via DEXA (reported in lbs)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: cardiorespiratory fitness via submaximal VO2 max (reported via ml/kg/min)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: muscle strength through multiple repetition maximum (lbs)

other_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
other_outcome.description: quality of life (short form health survey-36 [SF-36] & functional assessment of cancer therapy: general [FACT-G]), via questionnaire

other_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
other_outcome.description: depressive symptoms (center for epidemiological studies-depression scale [CES-D]), via questionnaire

other_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
change from baseline to 4 months, to 8 months to 1 year
other_outcome.description: and sleep quality (Pittsburgh sleep quality index [PSQI]) via questionnaire

arm_group.description: Will not receive the exercise intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- AYA cancer survivors (18-39) Must be 12 months after treatment No metastatic disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Metastatic disease Pregnancy
